metadata.title: CVE-2021-3609 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
.A flaw was found in the CAN BCM networking protocol in the Linux kernel,where a local attacker can abuse a flaw in the CAN subsystem to corruptmemory, crash the system or escalate privileges. This race condition innet/can/bcm.c in the Linux kernel allows for local privilege escalation toroot.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3609` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86
linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-77.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-lowlatency - 5.4.0-77.86
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-59-generic - 5.8.0-59.66~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-59-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-59.66~20.04.1
